content.content: General Updates  Dai in other networks (we are adding this segment in our weekly updates to follow Dai’s flow -thanks @SebVentures  for the suggestion-)   image1632×962 56.4 KB   Industrial Vaults/Custom Vaults: To develop this idea, we started conversations with our Vaults users to find out what they are missing in our portfolio so far. The first conversation was with the Yearn team. Take a look at @ultraschuppi post, which explains this YFI new vault type, with a higher Liquidation Ratio to get a lower Stability Fee. Thanks also to @PaperImperium, who has been actively showing us how important it is to understand what our top vault users want.   Star of the week   During the lasts weeks, MKR was listed in various exchanges. We want to be careful communicating this (to you -the community- and the outside). We need your help to find out what’s the best way to do it. Please, leave a comment here with your ideas.

Nadia:  During the lasts weeks, MKR was listed in various exchanges. We want to be careful communicating this (to you -the community- and the outside). We need your help to find out what’s the best way to do it. Please, leave a comment here with your ideas.   In my opinion and previous experience, exchange listing is celebrated and communicated on all channels. Unless our legal counsel says we cannot do it (i.e. for a specific region) then we definitely should. One can prioritize channels, i.e. we have 150K followers on twitter, so that’s probably top prio. This should be standardized really, as in, the person in charge of the social media channels should have a rather clear process on how to propagate the news: the format, the style, the added illustration/picture, the call-to-action, the people/orgs tagging, the hashtags, etc. This effort should always be planned at least 7 days beforehand in order to get every party involved aligned with the plan and everything signed off by the necessary parties. That’s what I did in my previous position, it’s not rocket science but needs a good methodology, some deep knowledge into crypto (ideally) and a decent level of creativity to come up with refreshing/fun/insightful content. This communication will come within a larger communication strategy where cadence of posts, tweets, twitter threads, and so on are defined on a long term plan. That will ensure a continuous engagement of our community and a gradual build up of content (vs a big bang followed by a 2 weeks radio silence). Last but not least, most meaningful collaborations/partnerships announcements should be coordinated with the party involved via a co-marketing effort; that’s pretty standard in the industry, an easy win to maximize the impact of the announcement. p.s. we’ll happily take care of that with the MarComm Unit, along with the help of other relevant teams (i.e. Growth and Content units). @Nadia maybe something we need to address in a separate thread?

First of all, thank you very much for sharing the great news with the community!     Nadia:  During the lasts weeks, MKR was listed in various exchanges. We want to be careful communicating this (to you -the community- and the outside). We need your help to find out what’s the best way to do it. Please, leave a comment here with your ideas.   Regarding the communication of new listings, I think it’s very important to be cautious about it. In my opinion, new listing announcements have became sort of a “mantra” for crypto orgs in the past couple of weeks, especially for new “shitcoins” which don’t do anything else but wait until some exchange lists them so they can share it on Twitter, Reddit, Telegram groups, etc. Unfortunately, the number of exchanges, however small/shady they may be, are often the main factor which new coins present to people as why they should invest in their token. Also, it seems to me that it became dangerously easy/available to pay some exchanges to list coins - this further undermines the validity of new listings. Don’t get me wrong, I still think it’s very important and desired to share the amazing news when a large/reputable exchange decides to list MKR. But I also believe there needs to be a balance. Maybe, new listings could be announced together once a week, or something like that so MKR’s social media does not get flooded with exchange listing announcements? Let me know what you think!

milan:  Don’t get me wrong, I still think it’s very important and desired to share the amazing news when a large/reputable exchange decides to list MKR   Agreed. There is no need to announce an exchange listing unless it is tick those boxes (large/reputable).     milan:  Maybe, new listings could be announced together once a week, or something like that so MKR’s social media does not get flooded with exchange listing announcements?   Yes, these should be bundled to avoid flooding our channels. i.e. we might want to have a maximum of one twitter post per day, meaning that if we have 4 listings to announce it would make sense to bundle some of them to leave space for other announcements.
Just curious, how are you thinking about announcing it? For example, Bithumb, one of the largest Korean exchanges, listed MKR recently. Curious what you would do in specifics
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: May 28 - June 2

content.content: General Updates  Dai in other networks.   image1652×988 76.8 KB   Going to the Bitcoin Conference in Miami, we will meet with companies like Blockfi, Celsius, Bitgo, Bitpay, Paxos, Wyre, Gemini, Fireblocks, Opera, Aave, and others (if you are in Miami, let us know!).   Star of the week  Bitera is the first Dai-exclusive wallet available for iPhone and Android. They integrated Dai on BSC and are now working on the integration of Dai on Polygon to become the mobile Dai hub for every blockchain where Dai is present. Yesterday they launched a communication and PR campaign in Argentina, and in the upcoming months, they will expand to Peru, Colombia, Chile, and Venezuela.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: April 29- May 6

content.content: General Updates   We are working with Binance to expand Dai as a savings currency in Nigeria and talking with local crypto companies to strengthen Dai’s presence in the country.   We are talking with different funds which are interested in opening a vault with their reserves.   We are having a lot of interest from our partners in Latam who want to explore the usage of Dai in BSC, Polygon and RSK    Star of the week  BitPay. This week BitPay will be live with Dai payments and settlement. Meaning that Dai is automatically supported on over 500 + merchants in BitPay’s network with notable companies such as Microsoft, Newegg, Twitch  (yes, you can buy bits with Dai ), American Red Cross, and WeWork. They reach over 3M users on their app and have a debit card and gift card network that supports purchases in crypto and will include Dai. Admin Stuff   Looking for someone in Europe to be part of the team, are you interested? send me a DM.   We are in the process of incorporating our company, setting everything up.   We are reorganizing our CRM to include collaborators from other CU.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

General Updates   We are working with other chains to find the best way to increase Dai adoption/visibility. There’s a huge interest, as the numbers show:  Polygon (166.8M Dai) Solana (work in progress) RSK (146k Dai) Avalanch (11.5M Dai) Tezos (126k Dai) Klaytn (82.8M Dai) BSC (261M Dai) Fantom (23M Dai) xDai (15.9M Dai)    We are working on identifying use cases related to Maker. Are we missing something? Do you want to help us? Please leave a comment, and I will contact you.    image570×738 23.2 KB   Star of the week   We have a new member in the team, he’s joining us as our DeFi advisor. I will reveal his name during the governance call. Hint, he’s a good guy
welcome back @nanexcool !!! Growht CU DeFi Advisor
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

General Updates  Dai in other networks.   image1632×984 69 KB   Talking with Nexo and other vault users to understand what they are looking for and how we can improve Maker Vaults   Star of the week   Crypto in India is currently booming, although they are facing some regulation uncertainties -as always-, exchanges are getting more traction (users and volume) and the crypto ecosystem is growing at a fast pace, with more than 340 crypto startups. We are working closely with Zebpay, with more than 3M users and Bitbns, a crypto company offering services like Dollar Cost Average strategies and an eCommerce in crypto. Shout out to @Jocelyn, who leads the Asia growth strategy, for her work with our partners in India.
